013package org.apache.juneau.microservice.jetty;
014
015import static java.util.logging.Level.FINE;
016import static java.util.logging.Level.FINEST;
017import static java.util.logging.Level.INFO;
018import static java.util.logging.Level.WARNING;
019import static org.apache.juneau.internal.SystemEnv.env;
020
021import java.util.logging.Level;
022import java.util.logging.LogRecord;
023import java.util.logging.Logger;
024
025/**
026 * Implementation of Jetty {@link Logger} based on {@link java.util.logging.Logger}.
027 *
028 * <p>
029 * Allows Jetty to log to the Java Util logging framework (and thus to the main log file defined in the
030 * <cc>[Logging]</cc> section).
031 *
032 * <p>
033 * Can be used by setting the following system property in the microservice config file.
034 *
035 * <p class='bini'>
036 *    <cs>[SystemProperties]</cs>
037 *
038 *    <cc># Configure Jetty to log using java-util logging</cc>
039 *    <ck>org.eclipse.jetty.util.log.class</ck> = org.apache.juneau.microservice.jetty.JettyLogger
040 * </p>
041 *
042 * <ul class='seealso'>
043 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-microservice-jetty">juneau-microservice-jetty</a>
044 * </ul>
045 */
046public class JettyLogger implements org.eclipse.jetty.util.log.Logger {
047   private static final boolean SHOW_SOURCE = env("org.eclipse.jetty.util.log.SOURCE", env("org.eclipse.jetty.util.log.javautil.SOURCE", true));
048
049   private Level configuredLevel;
050   private Logger logger;
051
052   /**
053    * Default constructor.
054    *
055    * <p>
056    * Returns the logger with name <js>"org.eclipse.jetty.util.log.javautil"</js>.
057    */
058   public JettyLogger() {
059      this("org.eclipse.jetty.util.log.javautil");
060   }
061
062   /**
063    * Normal constructor.
064    *
065    * @param name The logger name.
066    */
067   public JettyLogger(String name) {
068      logger = Logger.getLogger(name);
069      configuredLevel = logger.getLevel();
070   }
071
072    @Override
073    public org.eclipse.jetty.util.log.Logger getLogger(String name) {
074        return new JettyLogger(name);
075    }
076
077   @Override
078   public String getName() {
079      return logger.getName();
080   }
081
082   @Override
083   public void warn(String msg, Object... args) {
084      if (isLoggable(WARNING))
085         log(WARNING, format(msg, args), null);
086   }
087
088   @Override
089   public void warn(Throwable thrown) {
090      if (isLoggable(WARNING))
091         log(WARNING, "", thrown);
092   }
093
094   @Override
095   public void warn(String msg, Throwable thrown) {
096      if (isLoggable(WARNING))
097         log(WARNING, msg, thrown);
098   }
099
100   @Override
101   public void info(String msg, Object... args) {
102      if (isLoggable(INFO))
103         log(INFO, format(msg, args), null);
104   }
105
106   @Override
107   public void info(Throwable thrown) {
108      if (isLoggable(INFO))
109         log(INFO, "", thrown);
110   }
111
112   @Override
113   public void info(String msg, Throwable thrown) {
114      if (isLoggable(INFO))
115         log(INFO, msg, thrown);
116   }
117
118   @Override
119   public boolean isDebugEnabled() {
120      return isLoggable(FINE);
121   }
122
123   @Override
124   public void setDebugEnabled(boolean enabled) {
125      if (enabled) {
126         configuredLevel = logger.getLevel();
127         logger.setLevel(FINE);
128      } else {
129         logger.setLevel(configuredLevel);
130      }
131   }
132
133   @Override
134   public void debug(String msg, Object... args) {
135      if (isLoggable(FINE))
136         log(FINE, format(msg, args), null);
137   }
138
139   @Override
140   public void debug(String msg, long arg) {
141      if (isLoggable(FINE))
142         log(FINE, format(msg, arg), null);
143   }
144
145   @Override
146   public void debug(Throwable thrown) {
147      if (isLoggable(FINE))
148         log(FINE, "", thrown);
149   }
150
151   @Override
152   public void debug(String msg, Throwable thrown) {
153      if (isLoggable(FINE))
154         log(FINE, msg, thrown);
155   }
156
157   @Override
158   public void ignore(Throwable ignored) {
159      if (isLoggable(FINEST))
160         log(FINEST, "IGNORED EXCEPTION ", ignored);
161   }
162
163   private static String format(String msg, Object... args) {
164      msg = String.valueOf(msg);
165      if (args.length == 0)
166         return msg;
167      StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
168      int start = 0;
169      for (Object arg : args) {
170         int bi = msg.indexOf("{}", start);
171         if (bi < 0) {
172            sb.append(msg.substring(start)).append(" ").append(arg);
173            start = msg.length();
174         } else {
175            sb.append(msg.substring(start, bi)).append(String.valueOf(arg));
176            start = bi + 2;
177         }
178      }
179      sb.append(msg.substring(start));
180      return sb.toString();
181   }
182
183   private void log(Level level, String msg, Throwable thrown) {
184      LogRecord r = new LogRecord(level, msg);
185      if (thrown != null)
186         r.setThrown(thrown);
187      r.setLoggerName(logger.getName());
188      if (SHOW_SOURCE) {
189         StackTraceElement[] stack = new Throwable().getStackTrace();
190         for (int i = 0; i < stack.length; i++) {
191            StackTraceElement e = stack[i];
192            if (!e.getClassName().equals(getClass().getName())) {
193               r.setSourceClassName(e.getClassName());
194               r.setSourceMethodName(e.getMethodName());
195               break;
196            }
197         }
198      }
199      logger.log(r);
200   }
201
202   private boolean isLoggable(Level level) {
203      return logger.isLoggable(level);
204   }
205
206}
